Pengusaha Makin Ragu Berbisnis di RI, Apa Penyebabnya?
06 Nov 2019, 00:37 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Arbi Anugrah

Jakarta - Badan Pusat Statistik (BPS) kembali merilis Indeks Tendensi Bisnis (ITB). Secara umum laporan ini menunjukkan kondisi bisnis masih tumbuh namun tingkat kepercayaan pelaku usaha menurun. Pengamat Ekonomi Institute for Development of Economics and Finance (INDEF) Bhima Yudhistira Adhinegara menyetujui data BPS itu. Menurut Bhima, ada beberapa faktor yang menyebabkan kepercayaan pelaku usaha menurun. Faktor pertama yakni penghematan yang dilakukan masyarakat kelas menengah atas demi menghindari serangan resesi atau pun perlambatan ekonomi."Kalau kita lihat bisnis akan melambat. Jadi confidence, kepercayaannya akan melambat. Karena pertama ada faktor dari sisi konsumsi domestik itu memang melambat. Khususnya untuk kelas menengah atas, jadi mereka lebih banyak memprediksi resesi ekonomi akan datang, jadi mereka berhemat," kata Bhima kepada detikcom, Selasa (5/11/2019).Menurutnya, penghematan tersebut menyebabkan penjualan di sektor manufaktur dan perdagangan menurun. Belum lagi faktor perlambatan ekonomi global, harga komoditas yang masih fluktuatif, dan gejolak geopolitik. Faktor-faktor tersebut yang menurutnya menyebabkan kepercayaan pelaku bisnis menurun."Hal ini berpengaruh juga kan terhadap penjualan di sektor manufaktur, sektor perdagangan. Jadi kapasitas industrinya sekarang sedang diturunkan. Nah ini yang membuat pertama tendensi bisnisnya turun, jadi ada faktor global, kekhawatiran resesi ekonomi global, kemudian harga komoditas yang masih rendah, gejolak geopolitik itu berpengaruh," terang Bhima.Faktor lainnya yakni menurunnya investasi karena kapasitas tim ekonomi di Kabinet Indonesia Maju dinilai kurang untuk memberikan dampak positif ke iklim dunia usaha. Menurut Bhima, tim ekonomi dalam Kabinet Indonesia Maju masih banyak yang diisi oleh tokoh politik."Faktor lain sih kalau menurut saya ada di sektor investasi. Jadi banyak investor yang memang masih meragukan kapasitas dari Tim Ekonomi Pak Jokowi. Kemudian berikutnya lagi selain kapasitas Tim Ekonomi Pak Jokowi yang mungkin didominasi politik itu juga kurang bagus untuk iklim dunia usaha. Karena yang harusnya dibutuhkan untuk kali ini kan tim profesional," bebernya.Terakhir, menurut Bhima regulasi di Indonesia masih harus diperbaiki untuk mendongkrak daya saing Indonesia terhadap persaingan global. Bhima menilai, reformasi perizinan maupun birokrasi di Indonesia masih jalan di tempat, sehingga daya saing Indonesia menurun."Hal lainnya yang menjadi penting itu memang dari sisi perbaikan daya saing sama Ease of Doing Business (EODB) kita itu kan justru menunjukkan penurunan. EODB-nya stagnan di angka 73, indeks daya saingnya justru turun dari 45 ke 50. Nah ini kan artinya kan reformasi perizinan, reformasi birokrasi ini jalan di tempat," tutur Bhima.Sehingga, banyak negara yang menunda untuk ekspansi bisnisnya ke Indonesia atau pun merelokasi ke negara lain."Nah banyak yang memutuskan ya kalau nggak menunda untuk ekspansi di Indonesia, mereka relokasi. Cari negara lain yang ekosistem bisnisnya lebih bagus itu untuk sektor manufaktur. Itu mungkin yang membuat banyak pelaku bisnis mulai pesimis terhadap kondisi ekonomi sampai 2020-2021 ke depannya," pungkas Bhima.Sebagai informasi, sebelumnya Kepala BPS Suhariyanto mengatakan, pada triwulan III-2019 ITB sebesar 105,33. Angka itu lebih rendah dibandingkan dengan posisi triwulan II-2019 sebesar 108,81."Indeks Tendensi Bisnis masih bagus tapi tingkat optimismenya turun. Masih di atas 100, tapi optimismenya turun," ujarnya di Gedung BPS, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).ITB pada triwulan III-2019 dibentuk beberapa komponen seperti pendapatan usaha 106,92, penggunaan kapasitas produksi 107,56 dan rata-rata jumlah jam kerja dengan nilai 101,51.ITB sendiri merupakan indikator perkembangan dunia usaha yang menggambarkan kondisi bisnis dan perekonomian. Surveinya dilakukan oleh BPS dan Bank Indonesia (BI).BPS memperkirakan ITB pada triwulan IV-2019 akan kembali menurun ke posisi 104,79. Meski menurun angkanya masih di atas 100 yang menunjukkan masih adanya kepercayaan bisnis di Indonesia. Entrepreneurs are increasingly hesitant to do business in RI, what causes it?
Nov 6, 2019, 00:37 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Arbi Anugrah

Jakarta - The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) has released the Business Tendency Index (ITB) again. In general, this report shows that business conditions are still growing, but the level of business confidence has declined. Observers of the Institute of Economics for Economics and Finance (INDEF) Bhima Yudhistira Adhinegara approved the BPS data. According to Bhima, there are several factors that have caused business confidence to decline. The first factor is the savings made by the upper middle class in order to avoid a recession or economic slowdown. "If we see business will slow down. So confidence, confidence will slow down. Because first there is a factor in terms of domestic consumption that is indeed slowing down. Especially for the middle class above, so they predict more economic recession will come, so they skimp, "Bhima said to AFP on Tuesday (11/05/2019). According to him, these savings caused sales in the manufacturing and trade sectors to decline. Not to mention the global economic slowdown, commodity prices are still volatile, and geopolitical turmoil. These factors which according to him cause business confidence to decline. "This also affects sales in the manufacturing sector, trade sector. So the industrial capacity is now being reduced. Now this is what makes the first tendency of the business down, so there are global factors, recession fears the global economy, then commodity prices are still low, the geopolitical turmoil has an effect, "explained Bhima. Another factor is the decline in investment because the capacity of the economic team in the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet is considered insufficient to have a positive impact on the business climate. According to Bhima, there are still many economic teams in the Advanced Indonesian Cabinet that are filled by political figures. "Another factor is if I think there is in the investment sector. So many investors still doubt the capacity of the Economic Team of Pak Jokowi. Then next, in addition to the capacity of the Economic Team Pak Jokowi, who may be dominated by politics, is also not good for the business climate, because what should be needed for this time is a professional team, "he explained. Finally, according to Bhima, regulations in Indonesia must still be improved to boost Indonesia's competitiveness against global competition. Bhima rate, licensing and bureaucratic reforms in Indonesia are still in place, so that Indonesia's competitiveness is declining. "The other thing that is important is that in terms of improving our Ease of Doing Business (EODB) competitiveness, it actually shows a decline. EODB- it was stagnant at number 73, its competitiveness index actually dropped from 45 to 50. Now this means licensing reform, bureaucratic reform is stalling, "Bhima said. Thus, many countries are delaying expanding their businesses to Indonesia or relocating to other countries. "Well, many have decided that if they don't delay expansion in Indonesia, they will relocate. Look for other countries where the business ecosystem is better for the manufacturing sector. That may make many business people start pessimistic about economic conditions until 2020-2021 to in front of him, "concluded Bhima. For information, previously Head of BPS Suhariyanto said that in the third quarter of 2019 ITB was 105.33. The figure is lower than the quarter II-2019 position of 108.81. "Business Tendency Index is still good but the level of optimism is down. Still above 100, but the optimism is down," he said at the BPS Building, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5 / 2019) .ITB in the third quarter of 2019 formed several components such as operating income 106.92, the use of production capacity of 107.56 and the average number of hours worked with a value of 101,51.ITB itself is an indicator of the development of the business world that describes business conditions and economy. The survey was conducted by BPS and Bank Indonesia (BI). BP estimates ITB in the fourth quarter of 2019 will again decline to 104.79. Even though the figure is still declining above 100, it shows that there is still business confidence in Indonesia.
